contents.title: Ship logs from S3 Bucket with Lambda
contents.shortDescription: Send logs stored in S3 Bucket to Logz.io via a Lambda function

contents.title: General guide to shipping logs with Beats
contents.shortDescription: This document describes the way to get logs from your system to Logz.io using any of the Beats shippers

contents.title: General guide to shipping logs with Filebeat
contents.shortDescription: Filebeat is usually the best and easiest way to ship logs to Logz.io. It's a lightweight open source agent that collects and ships your logs to Logz.io.

contents.title: Configure an Amazon S3 Bucket
contents.shortDescription: Logz.io can pull new logs straight from your S3 bucket every few seconds.

contents.title: Ship Docker Swarm logs
contents.shortDescription: Want to analyze logs from docker containers? This is the best option for you - it uses Filebeat to collect logs from other Docker containers and ship them to your Logz.io account.

contents.title: Ship Docker logs
contents.shortDescription: Use Filebeat to collect logs from other Docker containers and ship them to your Logz.io account.

contents.title: Upload JSON logs
contents.shortDescription: If you want to ship logs from your code but don't have a library in place, you can send them directly to the Logz.io listener as a minified JSON file.

contents.title: Upload log files using cURL
contents.shortDescription: cURL is a command line utility for transferring data. cURL is a quick and easy way to test your configuration or troubleshoot your connectivity to Logz.io.

contents.title: Upload log files using Invoke-RestMethod
contents.shortDescription: Invoke-RestMethod is a command to interact with REST APIs in PowerShell. Invoke-RestMethod is a quick and easy way to test your configuration or troubleshoot your connectivity to Logz.io.

contents.title: Shipping with Logstash
contents.shortDescription: We only recommend using Logstash when you already have an existing Logstash configuration. Simply edit the config file to forward your logs to Logz.io.

contents.title: Ship Linux logs
contents.shortDescription: Send logs directly from your Linux machine with a single command.

contents.title: Ship Node.js logs
contents.shortDescription: Add this library to your code to begin shipping logs from your Node.js applications.

contents.title: Ship Windows logs
contents.shortDescription: Send logs directly from your Windows machine.

contents.title: Ship AppRunner logs
contents.shortDescription: Send logs from your AppRunner instances to Logz.io.

contents.shortDescription: Send logs from multiple AWS accounts to Logz.io.

contents.title: Shipping with Rsyslog
contents.shortDescription: Configure rsyslog to monitor a single log file or a directory, and then send it to Logz.io via TLS.

contents.title: Ship Kubernetes logs using a Fluentd DaemonSet
contents.shortDescription: Want to ship and analyze your Kubernetes logs? The Fluentd DaemonSet is a flexible way to get your Kubernetes logs into Logz.io.

contents.title: Ship S3 access logs

contents.title: Ship Python logs
contents.shortDescription: Use the Logz.io Python Handler to bulk send logs to Logz.io via HTTPS.
